intro: Willughbeia celebica, commonly known as the Celebes willughbeia, is a tropical evergreen tree native to Indonesia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its large, lance-shaped leaves and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests and is known for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and floral display. It plays an important role in the ecosystem as a habitat and food source for various wildlife species. However, it is relatively rare and faces threats from habitat loss and overharvesting.
